item.title: Wild Shape-Shifting Sofa Can Be Whatever You Want It to Be
item.description:
Wild Shape-Shifting Sofa Can Be Whatever You Want It to Be

Carlo Ratti, who founded MIT's forward-thinking Senseable City Lab, has designed a sofa called Lift-Bit. It is on display at La Triennale in Milan, where innumerable furniture-makers showcase their work in an annual design fair. Sofas (and chairs, for that matter) at Salone del Mobile are like fish in an aquarium: plentiful and beautiful, but, after a while, hard to discern.

item.title: What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3
item.description:
What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3

HAWTHORNE, California - I've had a terrible flu all week. My body aches, my head is pounding, and my throat feels like it might fall out of my neck. Right now, though, I'm riding in the Tesla Model 3, one of the most hotly anticipated cars in the world...

item.title: A Guide To Great Coffee In Kichijoji, Tokyo - Sprudge
item.description:
A Guide To Great Coffee In Kichijoji, Tokyo - Sprudge

Spring in Japan is marked by the cherry blossom, when pink clouds of the blooming flower paint on a canvas of clear blue sky. It's a time to celebrate the beautiful transience of life, which the locals often do at picnics in the park-known as -under a gentle rain of falling petals.

item.title: New Zealand's Otherworldly Landscapes
item.description:
New Zealand's Otherworldly Landscapes

If you flew south over these South Island alps and then carried on over the Pacific, your next sighting of land would be Antarctica. This view of the alps, from Blanket Bay lodge, was shared by some of the stars of the Lord of the Rings trilogy, who stayed here while filming.

item.title: The Best Hostel in Every Major European City
item.description:
The Best Hostel in Every Major European City

Staying at hostels was once a backpacker's rite of passage. After all, nothing builds character like fighting for power outlets,…

item.title: abitibi & co and Norquay Limited Edition Canoes
item.description:
abitibi & co and Norquay Limited Edition Canoes

by Mike Giles Two Canadian brands- abitibi & co and Norquay-brought together via a common love of canoeing have embarked on a three-year partnership to change the face of canoe craftsmanship.
